alert.note: Alert for Haskell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 1:04AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Haskell County through 145 AM CDT... At 102 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sagerton, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Haskell, Rule, Paint Creek, Sagerton and Us-380 Near The Haskell- Stonewall County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
